abstract: Shares in the Russian aluminum giant fell on their first day of trading in Hong Kong, but just being listed was seen as a win.
snippet: Shares in the Russian aluminum giant fell on their first day of trading in Hong Kong, but just being listed was seen as a win.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG  Shares in Rusal, the aluminum giant controlled by the Russian oligarch Oleg V. Deripaska, plunged nearly 11 percent Wednesday in their trading debut in Hong Kong, weighed down by global markets’ recent slump.

headline.main: Newly Public Rusal Slides, Following Markets’ Slump
headline.print_headline: Newly Public Rusal Slides, Following Markets’ Slump

byline.original: By Bettina Wassener and Andrew E. Kramer
